ratings.question_text: Your level of engagement with the course was:
What is your overall assessment of this course?
The course was well organized to facilitate student learning.
I received clear feedback that improved my learning.
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the level of intellectual challenge of this course was:
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the workload of this course was:

narratives.question_text: What knowledge, skills, and insights did you develop by taking this course?
comments: Signals and communication. I learned the basic principles and how to apply them. Made a fun game at the end of the semester using our knowledge
I gained knowledge on basic signal processing, AC DC conversion, and digital filtering.
I learned about the dtft and filters.

narratives.question_text: What are the strengths and weaknesses of this course and how could it be improved?
comments: The course is very interesting. Much more math-heavy than I thought it would be. It would have helped to review/teach some of the math before assuming we remembered it (probability, summations, etc.)
This course was overall straightforward. The expectations were clear and the feedback was immediate, and the lectures were relevant to the assignments.
The course is very confusing both in content and organization, feels like a loose jumble of topics thrown together

strengths:
- fun projects
- helpful projects
- projects are based on application
- great connection of theory with coding practice
- great book
- interesting homeworks

weaknesses:
- very harsh grading at the beginning of the semester

There was no big picture overview, a why this is important statement for the course. We learned various (at least to me, disparate) concepts, I don't understand how they all connect or their practical applications.

narratives.question_text: Would you recommend this course to another student? Please explain.
comments: It is an interesting class and teaches the basics of signals
I suppose if one wanted a basic introduction to signal processing this course is great. However, if a student has no interest, I wouldn't really recommend it.
No, this course was not worth it
yes. i think it introduces you to the world of communications in both theory and practice.
Yes if they need it for their major
